item.title: Go Test Parallelization
item.description: A brief introduction to using Go’s testing package’s T.Parallel() to parallelize tests. Problem Your Go project’s tests are slow and run serially. Or perhaps they’re not slow, but they run serially and could be faster. Solution Consider running the test cases in parallel. Simple non-parallelized example As a starting point, consider a simple non-parallelized test: package main import ( "io/ioutil" "os" "testing" "time" ) func TestSimple(t *testing.
